Cruise Insurance FAQ
How to purchase cruise insurance?
You are required to purchase your travel insurance based on the destination of your cruise trip. For example, if the destination is Sanya, you can purchase Blue Cross Travel Smart China Plan or Cruise Plan. If the cruise won’t enter the borders of China, you can get the Blue Cross Travel Smart China Plan, but you need to enter from Hong Kong upon return.
Can I buy two travel insurances and claim against both policies?
You can’t claim against both policies within the same insurance provider. It will usually just provide the highest coverage among all your policies.
What is the difference between cruise insurance and regular travel insurance?
Cruise covers are different from the standard travel insurance policies as cruise trips may tend to last longer than a normal holiday and it spans across several countries, therefore the premium is usually much higher.
What should I look out for when purchasing travel insurance for my cruise trip?
A good cruise insurance policy should cover cabin confinement, missed port departure, unused excursions, cruise interruption, emergency medical treatment, lost and stolen luggage, cancellation and curtailment, itinerary change and activities. Check out if your cruise insurance covers these necessary items.
